chunks.en: The department has started daily statistics on the number of lines of code submitted.
Today, the number of lines of code from yesterday were tallied, a ranking table was created, and it was sent to the group.
I asked and found out that statistics will be taken every day from now on.
Try not to reuse code that can be reused.

Please refer to Teacher Xiqiao's cartoon about using code volume to calculate KPI... Is this what programmers are getting? (Part 1) https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzAxMzMxNDIyOA==&mid=2655543803&idx=1&sn=71af5b312a839c4f5654991dda94bac1&scene=21#wechat_redirect Using code volume to calculate KPI... Is this what programmers are getting? (Part 2) https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzAxMzMxNDIyOA==&mid=2655543854&idx=1&sn=5934ca2b31d942145752a407d02fa7ac&scene=23&srcid=0728EAkDYVbYpeQHcMBkaSW9#rd

This is like JD.com requesting Gregorian calendars. What you should be considering is not how to stop JD.com from requesting them, but leaving this platform as soon as possible. This is just the surface; the underlying reason is that the company's business is not doing well.
When the KPI changes from "Defeat Apple" to "Catch the Latecomers"
When the morning meeting changes from "Strategic Planning" to "Reading the Attendance Sheet Aloud"
When executives turn the company into a terminal diagnosis machineâ€”cameras are their stethoscopes, time clocks are their respirators, and Excel spreadsheets are their EKGs.
Didi Didi doing innovation?
Impossible. They can't afford R&D expenses, but they can afford fingerprint scanners.
They can't compete on market competitiveness, but they can compete on employees' bladder capacity.
They can't grasp customer needs, but they can grasp who is taking a paid toilet break.
Others are doing AI, they're counting keyboard fingerprints.
Others are building rockets, they're adjusting the color temperature of the surveillance cameras.
Others are holding new product launches, they're holding "Toilet Time Commendation Meetings."
After all, making the product speak requires brains, but making the report speak only requires a thick skin.
I suggest changing the company's charter to the "Prison Guard Code" next time and awarding the administrative department a "Shackle Design Patent Award."
On the day of bankruptcy liquidation, remember to hang a banner: "Our company's attendance abnormality rate is 0, we died in perfect order!"
@wangtian2020 #87 Who are you disgusting with your veiled words?
The original poster didn't say they wanted to stay or that they had a mortgage. What's the meaning of you coming up and putting several labels on them?
The environment has become a sewer and instead of considering a job change, you adapt to the environment.
dos2unixunix2dos
+1 Just git add ./logs
@justfindu Copy code that can be reused as much as possible.
The person who set this rule definitely doesn't know how to write code.
@wangtian2020 It's easy for you to say that. If the leader announces this today, can you find a job today?
Complaining a couple of times has turned into being cheap and adapting to the environment?
Ridiculous.
It's simple, they count crudely, you deal with it crudely, move the third-party library code you use over bit by bit.
Change the code formatting rules every day and then commit.

chunks.en: Forcing employees to write inelegant and inefficient code. If it's Go development, they'd be ecstatic, if err effectively increases the number of lines.
The company has been counting for a year and requires no less than 6K lines of code changed each month.
Move the third-party library bit by bit ğŸ¤.
What kind of weird boss is this? Leave quickly! This kind of boss should be left to fend for himself.
Reformat the code every day with different rules.
Is this how Tencent does it? That's why every product is huge.
Looks like I need to remove node_modules from .gitignore.
